channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk’s X raises almost $1 billion in new equity funding
item.description: Elon Musk’s social network X has raised close to $1 billion in new equity from investors, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

item.title: Los Angeles Faces Nearly $1 Billion Deficit as It Rebuilds From Fires
item.description: Shifting federal policies, combined with the cost of January’s wildfires, have created “serious financial headwinds” for the city, officials said.

item.title: Jamie Dimon on tariffs, geopolitics—and the misery facing the bottom 20% of U.S. earners
item.description: The JP Morgan CEO said many consumers are suffering in the current economy.

item.title: Amtrak CEO departs amid threats of a transit funding pullback
item.description: Amtrak CEO Stephen Gardner is leaving his job as the Trump administration threatens to pull back on funding mass transit and transportation projects.

item.title: Judge Grants the Government Another Day to Share Details on Deportation Flights
item.description: Judge James Boasberg has asked the government to tell him what time two planes took off from U.S. soil and from where, what time they left U.S. airspa...

item.title: Chips on chips: Nvidia is partnering with Taco Bell’s parent company to leverage AI for a more efficient drive-thru experience
item.description: Taco Bell’s parent company will use Jensen Huang’s AI to count cars in drive-thru lines and suggest menu items to customers that take less time to mak...

item.title: Jury Finds Greenpeace Liable for More Than $660 Million in Damages
item.description: A lawsuit claimed Greenpeace had played a major role in protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline. Greenpeace has said a loss could put it out of bu...

item.title: Fed soothes ‘Trumpcession’ fears by keeping two interest rate cuts on the table
item.description: Stocks have tumbled amid President Donald Trump’s on-again, off-again tariff threats and global uncertainty.

item.title: Fed Holds Rates Steady and Predicts Higher Inflation, Slower Growth Ahead
item.description: The central bank penciled in two rate cuts for 2025, but President Trump’s sweeping agenda has injected “remarkably high” uncertainty into the outlook...

item.title: Musk Donates to G.O.P. Members of Congress Who Support Impeaching Judges
item.description: Amid a controversy over whether President Trump will abide by court rulings, Elon Musk gave the maximum to the campaigns of Republicans who back ousti...

item.title: What Pausing Strikes on Energy Sites Would Mean for Ukraine and Russia
item.description: An agreement to suspend such attacks will affect a strategy key to both countries’ efforts to weaken the other. It would also be a significant step to...

item.title: In Call With Trump, Putin Concedes Little on Ukraine
item.description: Although much of what Vladimir V. Putin agreed to during his call with President Trump was spun as a concession, the Russian leader stuck to the posit...

item.title: Astronomers Get ‘More Than a Hint’ That Dark Energy Isn’t What They Thought
item.description: New data further challenge the best scientific theory of the history and the structure of the universe. But a separate recent result reinforces it.
